text:
If anyone speaks *Spanish* — hoping you can do me a favor, I’m working on making the chrome extension multi-lingual (english + spanish to start)
I’m using Google Translate and I just want someone to quality check this so I don’t end up with either orcish spanish or complete flubs.

Original text:
```A Chrome/Chromium extension for HubSpot Developers that adds useful shortcuts to commonly used HubSpot query parameters, resources and tools for making HubSpot Development easier and more enjoyable.

*Buttons for activating commonly used HubSpot Query Parameters such as hsDebug, AMP, footer jQuery, and a cache buster
*Google Page Speed Insights Tester - great to see if moving jquery to the footer has a significant impact
*Quick access shortcuts to the most used areas of the HubSpot Dev Docs
*Optional Dark Theme for the Design Manager
*More features coming!

If you find a bug or want to request a feature please report it in our GitHub Issues.```

Translated text:

```Una extensión de Chrome / Chromium para desarrolladores de HubSpot que agrega accesos directos útiles a los parámetros de consulta de HubSpot comúnmente utilizados, recursos y herramientas para hacer que el desarrollo de HubSpot sea más fácil y divertido.

* Botones para activar los parámetros de consulta de HubSpot comúnmente utilizados, como hsDebug, AMP, footer jQuery y un cache buster
* Probador de estadísticas de velocidad de página de Google: excelente para ver si mover jquery al pie de página tiene un impacto significativo
* Accesos directos de acceso rápido a las áreas más usadas de HubSpot Dev Docs
* Tema oscuro opcional para el administrador de diseño
* ¡Más funciones por venir!

Si encuentra un error o desea solicitar una función, infórmenos en nuestros problemas de GitHub.```

While I can read most of it without issue having taken spanish classes in high school, I’m not fluent. Appreciate any help anyone can give.

Will have more strings to translate later.

Other Strings I need verified:
Debug Mode : `Modo de depuración`
Debug: `depurar`
Footer(as in footer jquery) : `Pie de página`

Bust Cache: `Caché de busto`

Develop(as in web develop not construction develop - if it’s the same thats fine): `Desarrollar`

Dark Theme: `Tema oscuro`

I am spanish, so I can manage:

Bust Cache: `Caché de busto` LOL
`busto` has different meaning here.
It could be as in English a way to talk about boobs, but doesn't have the meaning of "sense of break" so can't fit here.

`Ignorar caché` would be better.

the other strings are ok.

I will improve the text too
hahahaha thank you Gonzalo Appreciate it. I had a feeling about that one

mind looking this over?
Must have for HubSpot Developers, bringing quick access to commonly used query parameters, and adding convenience features to HubSpot: 
`Debe tenerlo para desarrolladores de HubSpot, lo que brinda acceso rápido a los parámetros de consulta de uso común y agrega funciones prácticas a HubSpot`
might have found out the top languages through this: <https://spin.d.pr/17PIRX+>
English German Spanish and Japanese
`Es esencial para desarrolladores de HubSpot porque brinda acceso rápido a parámetros de URL útiles además de añadir funcionalidades extra`
thank you I’ll pop that in :smile:

Almost there!
<https://spin.d.pr/xb2Cxz+>
Still needs IKEA as a language, I can work on small Icons for them lol
HAHAHA
yes
Den bästa HubSpot-utvecklarens förlängning :put_litter_in_its_place:
unfortunately since it uses the standard for internationalization we’d have to make to you have to be using the swedish language
but would still be hilarious
random swedish developer would be like:cool, someone finally translated an extension for me - why are half the words just symbols

Sweet I would say the spanish translation feature is almost ready for prime time. I didn’t translate all of the options page, and the results of the Google Page Speed index come out in english but the options page doesn’t have much on it.

can anyone check this translation for me?
Footer jQuery : `Pie de página jQuery`
I feel like it’s saying bottom of the page jquery, and I don’t know if that’s overkill
